episode_title: 317 - The One Without The Ski Trip

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler and Joey are sitting on the couch reading.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Can I see the comics?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: This is the New York Times .

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, may I see the comics?
[Monica and Phoebe enter.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Guys. I thought you were taking Ross to the game?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We are. He’s meeting us here.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No! Rachel is meeting us here.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh come on, they can be in the same room.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, you shoulda been there last night.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why? What happened now?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well Ross was hangin’ out over at our place, Rachel comes over to borrow some moisturiser from Chandler…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah y-you, how hard is it to say something? Rachel came over to borrow something.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Anyway! Her and Ross just started yelling at each other.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wait. Why was he yelling at her? He’s the one who slept with someone else.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I guess he says that because they were on a break when it happened, that she should of forgiven him by now.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Whoa!! He is soo unreasonable! God, although I think I understand what he means. Oh my God, this is like 60 Minutes , okay, when, when, at first you’re really mad at that pharmaceutical company for making the drug and then y’know you just feel bad for the people because they needed to make their hair grow.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know what this is like? This is like when my parents got divorced. Man, I hope Ross doesn’t try to kidnap me after Cub Scouts.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Y’know I had a dream where Ross and Rachel were still together, they never broke up. And we were all just like hanging out, and everyone was happy…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I had the same dream!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, and nobody slept with that Xerox girl.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, I had the opposite dream.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know what maybe it’s gonna be okay, I mean it’s been a week.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, I mean it’s never taken me a week to get over a relationship.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s never taken you more than a shower to get over a relationship.
[Rachel enters.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, let’s go!! Let’s hit the road!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Let’s get the show on it!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, let me just get a cup of coffee.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh Rachel, I know the best coffee house and it’s sooo close.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Closer than here?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, hey, look, I found coffee! (handing her the cup) Okay, let’s skedaddle.
content.parenthetical: turning around and picking a cup off of a table

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wait, I’m not just gonna drink somebody’s old coffee.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, your highness.
[Ross enters behind Rachel, and look at each other for a moment.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Um, Rachel I’m really sorry. (imitating Rachel) That’s okay, do you wanna get back together? (imitating Ross) Yeah, okay. (in her normal voice) Did anyone else hear that?!
content.parenthetical: in a deep voice, imitating Ross

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, the whole gang is there, except for Ross and Rachel. Joey is trying to eat Chinese with chopsticks and fails miserably. There’s a knock on the door, and Chandler answers it to reveal Rachel

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Is he here?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh. (smiles) Here’s your moisturiser. Hi!

content.speaker: Monica and Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You guys are gonna love meee! Okay, check it out, Thursday night, five tickets, Calvin Klein lingerie show, and you guys are coming with me. (they’re all silent and look away) Okay, I said that out loud right?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, yes, it’s just that we ah, we kinda all ready, made plans with Ross.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, well okay. Well, there you go.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, it’s just that he got this new like home theater dealie, and he wants y’know, us to check it out.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hm-mm.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, he’s really excited about it too, he even recorded show times on his answering machine.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We’re sorry honey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, it’s okay. (starts to leave)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Rach, it’s, it’s ah, it’s not that we don’t want to, really. (quietly) Are we talking models in their underwear?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And heels.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: (turning back to Rachel) Ross, did ask us first, and we set that night aside.
content.parenthetical: He turns around to Chandler looking for approval to go with Rachel, Chandler mouths ‘Come on!’

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, hey, come on, if he asked you first, that’s only fair. (leaves)
[Chandler makes a noise of absolute disgust and heads into the living room.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohhh boy, do I feel bad.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Very bad.
[We see Chandler lighting up a cigarette.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Chandler what are you doing?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God!
content.parenthetical: jumps back and points at the cigarette

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You’re smoking again?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, actually, yesterday I was smoking again. Today, I’m, I’m smoking still.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why would you start again after chewing all that quitting gum?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look, I’m telling you this is just like my parents divorce, which is when I started smoking in the first place.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Weren’t you nine?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeahhh. I’m tellin’ ya something, that ah, first smoke after nap time…
[There’s a knock on the door.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh that’s great, with my luck, that’s gonna be him.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Him? Him, Ross?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nope, hymn 253, His Eyes Are On The Sparrow! When my parents got divorced is when I started using humour as a defence mechanism. (answers the door and it’s Rachel again.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi! Uhh, do you guys have plans for the weekend? Because I have my sister on hold, and she said that we could use her cabin for the weekend and go skiing. Huh? I’m asking you first, right?!. I mean I’m playing by the rules.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Absolutely, yeah!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Chandler! You’re smoking? What are you doing?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, shut up!! You’re not my real Mom!!

content.description: Ross’s, the gang, minus Rachel of course, is there. Chandler is forced to smoke by an open window.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, can you close that window Chandler? My nipples can cut glass over here!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wait. Really?! ‘Cause mine get me out of tickets.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, you guys I just wanna say, I really, really appreciate you spending this time with me. It’s been a pretty hard time right now, so I just wanna say thanks.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Can somebody else hug him? I have to stay by the window.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh hey, hey, huh, how about this weekend we have a laser disc marathon okay, and maybe a tournament on my new dart board? Huh, huh, what do you think? (in an Irish accent) Two days of darts, it’ll be great!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’ll be great for next weekend.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no, no, this weekend guys!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’ll be great for next weekend. I mean, (in an Irish accent) it’ll be grrreat.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What’s going on?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, we were um, sorta invited to go skiing, y’know Rachel’s sister’s cabin. (Chandler goes back to the window to smoke again.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So, for the whole weekend?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We’re really sorry, but um, she did ask us first.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, that’s okay, I mean if you guys all have to go away for the first weekend I’m alone by myself, y’know then I totally, totally understand.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Y’know what, I can stay, I’m gonna stay. ‘Cause the last time I went skiing I was to afraid to jump off the chair lift, I just went around and around.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, Pheebs we kinda need you to drive us all up there in your grandmother’s cab, but y’know what, I’ll stay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Noo! I’ll stay. He’s my brother.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What a pity stay?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No! We’re gonna have fun. We can make fudge!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Pity food? Y’know what that’s okay, all right, I don’t need any of you to stay, okay nobody stays.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, then, I might as well offer to stay.

content.description: In Phoebe’s Grandmother’s cab, driving up to the cabin. Phoebe’s driving, Rachel’s sitting shotgun, Chandler, Monica, and Joey are in the back seat.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, does anybody else feel bad about Ross?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why? Do you think he’s still mad at us?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well he’s probably mad after you called him this morning to borrow his goggles.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What? Mine aren’t tinted.
[Chandler starts to light a cigarette.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Chandler!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What does the sign say?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Beam me up Jesus.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, the ‘No Smoking’ sign. There’s no smoking in my Grandmother’s cab.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, well, then, I-I have to go to the bathroom.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oh!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Please!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No Chandler no! No unscheduled stops. You can go when we stop for gas.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, come on, there’s a rest stop right up there! Come on, I really have to goooooooooo.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, now I have to go!!

content.description: The rest stop, Phoebe’s pulling in.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Here we go. Okay, brace yourselves.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?
[Both Chandler and Joey put their feet up against the glass, Monica doesn’t and gets thrown up against the glass.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ow!
[Joey gets out and sprints to the bathroom and Chandler follows with a cigarette in his hands.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Aren’t you gonna go?
content.parenthetical: to Rachel, who’s staying in the cab.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No. Thank you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, Rachel never pees in public restrooms.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, they never have any paper in there y’know. So my rule is ‘no tissue, no tuschy.’ (Phoebe laughs and gets out.) Well, if everybody’s going. (She gets out and starts to close the door.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, y’know what don’t close it (Rachel slams the door shut locking themselves out.) ‘cause the… keys.. are in there.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, no-no-no-no-no-no!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What’s going on?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: My lighter’s in there! (points to the cab)

content.description: The rest stop, the gang is still stuck, Chandler is kneeling at the rear bumper.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Damn! (stands up) The tailpipe’s not hot enough to light this!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Relax okay, I-I-I can get this open. Anybody have a coat hanger?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh I do! Op, no, wait a minute, I took it out of my shirt when I put it on this morning.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So, if you’re parents hadn’t got divorced, you’d be able to answer a question like a normal person?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, I just need a wire something to jimmy it. Oh hey, one of you guys give me the underwire from your bra!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on! Who has the biggest boobs?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Please!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoever has the biggest boobs, has the biggest bra, therefore has the biggest wire.

content.speaker: The Girls
content.text: No, not getting my bra!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: If you wanna get back in the car, we need the wire, your call.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, Monica’s are the biggest.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: These tiny, little non-breasts?! Please, it’s gotta be Rachel.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What, no, no, no, mine are deceptively small I mean, I-I-I actually sometimes, st-stuff my bra.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right then, your bra would still be big.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, I stuff outside the bra.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ladies, ladies, let’s just compromise okay? Phoebe, Rachel take off Monica’s bra.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right, forget it, nevermind, you can have mine.
[Chandler crumples up his cigarette pack and throws it on the ground.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Chandler, what are you doing? There is a trash can right there.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I thought if I littered, that crying Indian might come by and save us.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, there.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thank you Phoebe, that is very, very generous.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, now let’s decide who has the nicest ass.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And there you go!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oh, yeahhhhh!!!
[They all run to get in the cab, and Chandler pulls out a smoke.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: At least let me smoke it to the good part.
[Phoebe puts the car in gear and starts to back out.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. (The car moves a few feet and sputters to a stop.) Oh, no!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What, what’s it, what’s going on?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, this has happened before.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So you know how to fix it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yep. Put more gas in.

content.description: Carol and Susan’s, Carol is setting a romantic dinner for Susan as there is a knock on the door.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Hey, what are you doing here?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, oh just ah, I was just wondering, when you and I split up, did you get the tape that was half the last episode of M*A*S*H and half the hostages coming home?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Ah yeah, but now it’s Susan and me in Mexico and the hostages coming home.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Where’s Ben?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: He’s sleeping.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ahh. (notices the table) Ooh, is this a ah, is this a bad time?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Umm, yeah, actually, Susan’s gonna be home any minute, it’s kinda an anniversary.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh! I thought you guys got married in uh, January?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: It’s not that kind of anniversary.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ah! (realises) Oh.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Sooo!! Anyway…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Umm, candles, champagne, yeah anniversaries are great. ‘Cause you know love lasts forever, y’know. Nothing like it in this lifetime, money in the bank, so Rachel and I broke up.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Oh God, Ross I am so sorry.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, well.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Y’know what, I want to talk to you about this so much, but we should probably do it when we could really get into it, are you free for dinner tomorrow night?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh yeah, I’d love that.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Oh, great! Me too.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I guess it all started when Rachel got this new job. (he sits down at the table.)

content.description: The rest stop, Phoebe is on the phone to the motor club.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, yeah. (to Monica and Rachel) Triple A can pick us up.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Great!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, what town are we near?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Freemont. West-Westmont, ah Westburg?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Then why are you answering? Do you at least know what route we’re on?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, we are definitely on Route 27.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. (on phone) We are at a rest stop on Route 27. Okay. (to Rachel) There is no Route 27. (listens) (to Rachel) Okay, either 93 or 76?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know, I’m sorry, I always slept in the back when we drove up here.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. (on phone) Hey, can you send somebody up and down 76 and check every rest stop, and, and also 93? (listens) Okay! (hangs up) Yeah, no they don’t do that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ugh, okay, well somebody will come and save us.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Who? I mean have you seen a car come by here in the last hour and a half? I think we should call Ross, maybe he can get a car and come pick us up.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! No, I am not getting in a car with Ross, we will just have to live here!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But if…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No you guys, I am not getting in a car with him, you’ll have to think of something else.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh good, oh Joey and Chandler are back.
[Joey walks up helping Chandler.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So the going for help went well?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah, Smokey Joe here got half way to the highway and collapsed.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I have the lung capacity of a two year old. (starts to light another cigarette.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Then why are you smoking?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well it’s very unsettling.

content.description: Carol and Susan’s, Ross is eating the dinner Carol made for Susan.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: …right? Right? I mean it’s pretty unbelievable y’know, I mean they just took off, took off without even looking back. Y’know I don’t, I don’t need them, huh, I’ve got you guys now as friends, you and Susan.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Ah, Susan will be so pleased.
[Ross’s beeper goes off.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: 717? (to Carol) Where’s 717? (He gets up to return the page, Carol starts to take the last of the food into the kitchen, but Ross grabs the last piece.) Hey, you’ve have more of these for Susan right?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: No. But it’s okay, I’ll just put out pickles or something.
[Cut to the rest stop, Monica and Phoebe are waiting anxiously by the phone as it rings.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: (whispering) Ross, thank God.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Pheebs? What, why are you whispering?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I ate a bug.
[Rachel starts to walk up.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey Rach, the tampons here are only a penny. Let’s stock up. (takes her into the bathroom)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Listen Ross, we ran out of gas, and we don’t know where we are, so we can’t get a tow truck.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, now you want a favour?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes, please.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, oh, I’m sorry your car broke down Pheebs, but I’m a little too busy with some of my real friends right now, but please call to let me know you got home safely okay?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: (on phone) Phoebe, hang on a second. (Hands Ross her keys) Here, take my car, go pick up your friends.
content.parenthetical: running over and grabbing the phone away from Ross

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, I’m not gonna pick them up.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Listen, we both know you’re gonna do it ‘cause you’re not a jerk. Okay? So you can either sulk here for a half hour and then go pick them up, or save us both time and sulk in the car.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, Rachel doesn’t want me to…

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Look, I-I-I am sorry that Rachel dumped you ‘cause she fell in love with that Mark guy, and you are the innocent victim in all of this, but don’t punish your friends for what Rachel did to you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, you’re right.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Phoebe hang on a second Ross wants to say something. (listens) What? (listens) (to Ross) You slept with someone else?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We were on a break!!! Okay!! (grabs the phone) We were, we were…, (calms down) yeah. Where are you? I’ll find you. (hangs up)

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: You slept with another woman?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, you-you’re-you’re one to talk.

content.description: The rest stop, Joey is making a sign.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, done.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What’s ‘pleh’?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s ‘help’ spelled backwards so that the helicopters can read it from the air!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Huh. What’s doofus spelled backwards?
[Ross drives up.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Op, op, car! Car!! (sees it’s Ross) Ugh!!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, it’s Ross on one of his drives!

content.speaker: Chandler and Joey
content.text: Hey!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What is he doing here?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: He is saving your butt, ah, unless of course I’m stepping on some toes here, in which case I can just mosey on, I’ve got plenty of people to help on the Interstate.

content.speaker: All
content.text: No! Come on!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right!! Fine! Fine.
{Ross grabs the gas can he brought along, and walks through Joey’s sign destroying it.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Arrrghh!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh no, now it’s not gonna make any sense!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You guys, what, what do we do about Ross who drove all the way up here? What do we do? Just like send him back and we’re then gonna go skiing?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, this is horrible, it’s just horrible.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Guys, do you think we should ask Ross to come along?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know, what about Rachel? I mean how are we even gonna ask her?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ask me what?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Umm, if ah, it might be okay if Ross came skiing?

content.speaker: Chandler, Phoebe, and Joey
content.text: No, I wasn’t gonna ask you that, no.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You guys are unbelievable. No! He cannot come.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Excuse me?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s horrible.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh please, can’t I come to your special, magical cabin?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why would you even want to come Ross? You’re a horrible skier.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh-oh, hitting me where it hurts, my ski skills.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Here we go again.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I-I can’t handle this, you guys.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know what, I can handle it, handle’s my middle name. Actually it’s the ah, middle part of my first name.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right Pheebs, your cab’s ready.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, let’s go!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re welcome.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I’m sorry, were you speaking to me or sleeping with someone else?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We were on a break!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know Ross why don’t you put that on your answering machine!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey-hey, it’s valid okay? And I’m not the only one who thinks so, Monica agrees with me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t know.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s what you said last night.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What I said was, was that I understood. Joey’s the one who agreed with you!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really Joey?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Y’know what, but there is, there is no right or wrong, here.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, I think it’s very obvious who’s wrong here.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Obviously not to Joey.
[They all turn around and look at Joey.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?
[They all start fighting with each other.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look both, Joey and Monica feel the same way that I do. No-no-no-no.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Guys, guys, guess who I am?! (starts dancing around in an effort to stop the fighting.)
[They stop briefly to look at Chandler, but then start fighting again.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey! Hey! Hey! Hey!! Hey!!! (they all stop fighting, Chandler continues to dance.) Look what you’re doing to Chandler!! (Chandler finally stops) (to Ross and Rachel) Yeah, look, we know this is really, really hard for you guys. Okay? (Ross starts to leave) You don’t, all right you don’t have to love each other, okay? You don’t, you don’t even have to like each other much right now. But please, you have to figure out a way to be around each other.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, and not put us in the middle.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, otherwise, I mean that’s, that’s, that’s just it for us hanging out together. Y’know is that what you want? (they both look away) Can you be civil?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I can.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. Good, all right, let’s get back in the car, ‘cause it’s freezing, and my chest is unsupported.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh what, wait, wait a second, I mean, what are we doing? Who’s going with who?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, you guys, you guys should go. (Joey tries to say something, but Ross cuts him off.) No, I’m, you, you planned this all out, and I don’t want to ruin it, so you guys should just go.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on man, you drove all the way up here.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no, really, I’ve got to take the car back anyway, I’m spending all day tomorrow with Ben, It’s fine, no guilt I promise.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, we’ll call you when we get back.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Maybe we can like go to a movie or something.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Or, or the rodeo!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That would be great.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I was being Shelly Winters from The Poseidon Adventure .

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know!
[They all get in the cab and drive away.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Bye!!!
[Ross tries to start the truck, and discovers the battery’s dead.]

content.description: Carol and Susan’s, Carol is running to answer the door.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Ugh. (opening the door) Ross!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi! Sorry I’m late. Were you sleeping?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Ahh, nooo!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, great! Listen, oh I had to get you a whole new battery. I got you the best one I could, ‘cause that’s not where you want to skimp.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: You’re a genius, Ross.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, well it came to about $112, but what the hell, just call it an even 110?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Okay, I’ll pay you tomorrow. (pushes him out the door)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Okay, bye!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So they ah, they all took off, it was pretty hard watching them go, y’know?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Yeah, okay, bye. (closes the door, turns out the lights, and runs back to the bedroom)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So I’m gonna take off then!
